meanings.definition: To remove from the priesthood or clerical status.
meanings.sent1: The bishop was disfrocking the priest for his wrongdoing.
meanings.sent2: The church disfrocked the pastor after a serious investigation.
meanings.sent3: The disfrocking of the minister caused quite a stir among the parishioners.
meanings.sent4: Disfrocking the reverend felt like tearing a page from the sacred book of faith.
meanings.sent5: The solemn ceremony of disfrocking left a lasting impact on the congregation.

meanings.definition: The act of stripping someone of their religious authority or position.
meanings.sent1: The disfrocking of the priest was a significant event in the church.
meanings.sent2: After the scandal, the disfrocking of the bishop was inevitable.
meanings.sent3: The sudden disfrocking of the pope led to confusion among the clergy.
meanings.sent4: The disfrocking of the nun was like removing a crown from a queen.
meanings.sent5: Witnessing the disfrocking of the cardinal was a moment of great solemnity.
